A mum kite has just laid an egg in the flowerpot outside my window! Poor thing! We've taken away her trees with our hi-rises!
@BDUTT Devastating! Human life's the most expendable product now!
@ranvirshorey Good luck with The Blue Mug guys! Break a leg! Rather all your legs!
@bedit That was a different kite! That was a paper kite while this one's a real
column4: live bird!

text: Thanks guys! I think we'll let it build its nest. Won't open the window to that balcony until the fledging kites have flown away...
Welcome Kunal Basu
column4: the author of The Japanese Wife at @kunalbasu100! Welcome to twitterworld Kunal!

text: Trees have been cut; high rises have come up. Where will the kites go? Or the elephants
column4: or the Adivasi-s when we take away their forests?

text: @apurvnagpal It was about a film that worked for u. U wrote it in reply to someone else; so I don't know what film u were referring to!
A kite is trying its best to build its nest in our balcony while we keep clearing out the twigs it's collected! Feel terrible! What to do?
@subhradipdas I expect Iti Mrinalini to release in June. But before that comes The Japanese Wife on 9th April in Kol

text: @vjrockss Reading Brian Bryson's 'A Short History Of Nearly Everything' with avid interest. It's a book on astrophysics. I must be INSANE!

Hi Tony! Welcome to Twitterworld!

text: Finished the final cut of my film Iti Mrinalini...a sudden sense of emptiness. How filmmaking consumes us!
